description:
Tree pruning works in the New River Conservation area
Notification has been received to carry out the following works:
X1 Sycamore  (11m, dbh 300mm) outgrown location fell to ground level.
decision_conditions:
The removal of this tree has been approved as part of planning application P100535. This application for a new extension permitted the removal of the Sycamore in the rear garden subject to the following condition( P100535 (C4):
CONDITION: Prior to the commencement of any works on site, full details including the size, species and location of at least one replacement tree to mitigate the loss of the Sycamore tree shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The replacement tree shall be planted in accordance with the details so approved during the first planting season after the date of the first occupation of the development hereby approved. The tree planted must have a two year maintenance/watering provision commencing after the date it is planted. Any tree that dies within five years of planting shall be replaced to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority with the same species or an approved alternative.

REASON: To ensure that a satisfactory standard of visual amenity is provided and maintained in accordance with policy Env6 of the Islington Unitary Development Plan 2002.

The applicant has provided details confirming the intention to plant two Mongolian Lime trees in the rear garden of the property. Confirmation that the trees would be heavy standard nursery stock (with 14-16cm girth) and a plan of the proposed location has been obtained and considered acceptable by the tree officer tand to satisfy the requirements of the condition.
